body:
The reason for this is that the probabilistic methods of the pipeline are not implemented.

Also related to https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2313,
some may be set incorrectly.

rename.from: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline does not look at the capability of underlying forecaster when using `predict_interval`
rename.to: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline does not look at the capability of underlying forecaster when using `predict_quantile` or `predict_interval`

rename.from: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline does not look at the capability of underlying forecaster when using `predict_quantile` or `predict_interval`
rename.to: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline does not look at the capability of underlying forecaster when using `predict_quantiles` or `predict_interval`

rename.from: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline does not look at the capability of underlying forecaster when using `predict_quantiles` or `predict_interval`

body:
Actually, this is a special case of
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2088

and not a bug - the reason is "currently not implemented".
@fkiraly is there a timeline for this implementation? It is breaking the pipeline we have in pycaret since we can not do prediction intervals anymore.

The end state would be that `predict_interval` etc works.

The problem is not the tag setting, the problem is that the logic is not implemented.

Help would be appreciated!
For the `ForecastingPipeline`, the logic should be easy - the inner `predict` in the outer `predict` should be replaced by `predict_interval` for the outer `predict_interval` etc, and arguments patched through.

For `TransformedTargetForecaster`, you'd additionally need to inverse transform the lower/upper etc.

> It is breaking the pipeline we have in pycaret since we can not do prediction intervals anymore.

Is it? Did it work before?

> Is it? Did it work before?

This is the structure of our pipeline

```
ForecastingPipeline
    - step_transform_x
    - ...
    - step_transform_x
    - TransformedTargetForecaster
        - step_transform_y
        - ...
        - step_transform_y
        - model (e.g. ARIMA)
```
`return_pred_int` in `predict` (version 0.10.1) worked with the `ForecastingPipeline`. But with the 0.11.0 release, I have to switch to using `predict_quantiles` (due to deprecation of `return_pred_int`) and that does not work anymore.
let me give it a shot
Wow, @fkiraly that was quick. Could you please apply these changes to `TransformedTargetForecaster` as well? Thank you do much!

>  Could you please apply these changes to TransformedTargetForecaster as well? Thank you do much!

That is not as easy, since we need to back-transform the proba outputs. It will also be "correct" only for `_predict_interval` and `predict_quantiles`.

> Wow, @fkiraly that was quick

And no guarantees that it works at the first attempt.

> That is not as easy, since we need to back-transform the proba outputs. It will also be "correct" only for _predict_interval and predict_quantiles.

I am only using predict_interval and predict_quantiles for now so that would work if it is available.

issue.title: [BUG] `update` of forecasting pipelines does not transform model

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Update by @fkiraly: the root cause of the below is, probably, forecasting pipelines not performing transform in the `update` method. Changed the title to reflect this.

---

**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
`update_predict_single` no longer refits the model in v0.10.1

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
forecast_horizon=24
cov=0.95
preds, conf_ints = model.update_predict_single(
    y=y_new, X=None, 
    fh=np.arange(1, forecast_horizon+1),
    update_params=True,
    return_pred_int=True, alpha=1-cov
)
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The model should be refitted when setting `update_params` to True. It seems like the property class `_y` attribute gets updated with the new observations, but the model is not refitted, and predictions returned are just longer forecasts of the originally trained model.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->
System:
    python: 3.8.11 (default, Jan 25 2022, 23:19:55)  [Clang 13.0.0 (clang-1300.0.29.3)]
executable: /Users/tsangis/Projects/uk-ds-day-ahead-prices-forecast/venv/bin/python
   machine: macOS-12.0.1-x86_64-i386-64bit

Python dependencies:
          pip: 22.0.3
   setuptools: 58.0.4
      sklearn: 1.0.2
       sktime: 0.10.1
  statsmodels: 0.13.1
        numpy: 1.21.1
        scipy: 1.7.3
       pandas: 1.4.1
   matplotlib: 3.5.1
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.55.1
     pmdarima: 1.8.4
      tsfresh: None

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->

body: @fkiraly Since #2318 is implemented, can we close this or do you think anything else is pending on this issue? Thanks!
